English: You've just become a hacker recently, right?
Chinese: 你是最近才成為駭客的？
Korean: 댁, 해커가 된 건 최근이지?
German:
Du bist vor Kurzem erst ein Hacker geworden,
nicht wahr?

English: Just like I thought.
Chinese: 我就知道。
Korean: 그럴거라고 생각했지
German: Das dachte ich mir.

English:
You sure look green enough, but it's more about
the Digimon programs you have. Does everyone in
Hudie use those?
Chinese:
除了感覺不同之外，
最明顯的是你有“數碼寶貝程式”，
hudie的那些人也有在用嗎？
Korean:
분위기도 그렇지만 무엇보다 "디지몬 프로그램"을 갖고 있으니까.
후디에 녀석들도 그 녀석을 쓰는 건가?
German:
Du wirkst noch ziemlich grün hinter den Ohren,
aber es geht mehr um die Digimon-Programme,
die du hast. Nutzen die alle bei Hudie?

English:
No kidding? And here I thought those guys liked to
keep things old school. ...Guess people do change.
Chinese:
哦～以為還像以前一樣執著古板做法呢。
……人是會變的啊。
Korean:
헤에…… 아직도 옛날처럼 구식 방법을 고집하고 있는 줄
알았어. ……사람은 변하는 법이군
German:
Im Ernst? Und ich dachte, sie machen alles wie
früher. ... Manchmal ändern sich Leute wohl doch.

English:
Heck, they fell under Zaxon's beck and call before
I even knew it...
Chinese: 不知曾幾何時，還變成了Zaxon的部下嗎……
Korean: 어느 틈엔가 잭슨 산하로 들어가버렸고……
German:
Ach, sie wurden schon vor meiner Zeit von
Zaxon herumkommandiert ...

English: Oops, sorry. We're here to talk about Jude, right?
Chinese: 啊，抱歉，是要說關於Jude的事吧。
Korean: 아아, 미안. 쥬드에 대해 얘기하고 있었지
German:
Huch, tut mir leid. Wir wollten über Gamma reden,
nicht wahr?

English:
...Jude was active several years ago. Digital
Monsters hadn't been discovered yet back then.
Chinese:
……Jude是在幾年前開始活動。
那個時候，大家還不知道數碼寶貝的存在。
Korean:
……쥬드가 활동하던 건 수 년전 일이야.
그 무렵엔 아직 디지털 몬스터 같은 게 알려지지 않아서
German:
... Gamma war vor mehreren Jahren aktiv. Damals
waren digitale Monster noch nicht entdeckt.

English:
Hackers would use tools they'd made themselves to
do their hacking.
Chinese: 駭客都是用自己做的工具來入侵程式。
Korean:
해커는 자기들이 만든 독자적인 툴을 써서
해킹을 하고 있었지
German:
Hacker nutzten zum Hacken Werkzeuge, die sie
selbst entwickelt hatten.

English: And then there was Jude--the biggest hacker team.
Chinese: 其中規模最大的就是——駭客集團“Jude”。
Korean:
그 중에서도 특히 규모가 컸던 게――
해커 팀 "쥬드"
German: Und dann war da Gamma, das größte Hackerteam.

English:
At the very least, you've heard the name of their
leader, right? ...Arata Sanada.
Chinese:
你至少有聽過隊長的名字吧？
……叫做“真田新”。
Korean:
리더의 이름 정도는 들어본 적 있지?
……"사나다 아라타"라고 하는데
German:
Du hast zumindest von ihrem Anführer gehört, oder?
... Arata Sanada.

English: ...Uh, well okay, then.
Chinese: ……算了，不知道也沒關係啦。
Korean: ……뭐, 상관없지만
German: ... Äh, na gut.

English:
Jude wasn't just the biggest team, but the one
with the most technical expertise, too.
Chinese:
Jude不只是規模很大，而且團隊中
每個人都技術高超……聽說啦。
Korean:
쥬드는 규모도 컸지만 무엇보다
한 사람 한 사람의 기술력이 높은 팀이었다……고 하더라
German:
Gamma war nicht nur das größte Team, sondern
verfügte auch über das meiste technische
Know-how.

English:
And their second-in-command was your leader,
Ryuji Mishima.
Chinese:
在這些人裡排名第二的就是
你那邊的隊長，御島龍司。
Korean:
그 녀석들 중 넘버 2를 맡고있던게
너희 팀 리더인 미시마 류지야
German:
Und der stellvertretende Anführer war euer
Anführer, Ryuji Mishima.

English:
That Arata Sanada guy had the skill, but...
Well, let's just say he was a bit reckless.
Chinese:
叫真田新的那位，雖然技術了得……
但好像是個喜歡胡亂鬧事的傢伙。
Korean:
사나다 아라타란 녀석은 기술은 있어도
……뭐어 무모한 녀석이었다는 듯 해
German:
Arata Sanada hatte das nötige Talent, aber ...
Nun ja, er war etwas waghalsig.

English:
Ryuji was his deputy of sorts, and always followed
him around. Kind of like a...a big brother.
Chinese:
龍司就像一名副官，一直跟在身邊輔佐他。
……就像是親哥哥一樣。
Korean:
류지가 보좌관으로 녀석을 보완해주고 있었지.
……친형같은 느낌으로
German:
Ryuji war sozusagen sein Stellvertreter und folgte
ihm überallhin. Wie ein ... ein großer Bruder.

English:
Third-in-command was Chitose Imai. You know who
I'm talking about.
Chinese: 排名第三的是今井千歲，這個人你也知道吧。
Korean: 넘버 3는 이마이 치토세. 이 녀석도 알겠지
German:
Der Dritte im Bunde war Chitose Imai. Du weißt,
wen ich meine.

English:
That guy's always been good with people, and kept
the friction down on such a big team. Like grease
for a bunch of squeaky wheels.
Chinese:
從以前就是個處事圓滑的人，
擅長減少大型團隊裡的摩擦，
像是潤滑劑一般的傢伙。
Korean:
옛날부터 붙임성이 좋아서 큰 팀과의 마찰을 줄여주는
완충재같은 존재였어
German:
Er kam schon immer gut mit Leuten aus und
minimierte die Spannungen in so einem großen Team.
Er war quasi das Maschinenöl.

English:
He looks chill, and has a good eye for people.
With him around, most arguments would work
themselves out.
Chinese:
看起來輕浮，其實很會察言觀色，
只要有他介入，不論什麼爭執通常都能解決。
Korean:
가벼워보이지만 사람을 잘 꿰뚫어보는 녀석이라
녀석이 끼어들면 어떤 분쟁이라도 대체로 해결됐지
German:
Er wirkt cool und kann Leute gut einschätzen.
Durch seine Anwesenheit lösten sich die
meisten Streitigkeiten in Luft auf.

English:
Several other hackers on the team could assemble
unique malware...
Chinese:
其他還有幾位，都是能獨立製作
惡性軟體的駭客——
Korean:
그 외에 독자적인 악성코드를 구축할 수 있는 
해커가 몇 명인가 있어서――
German:
Und einige Hacker im Team konnten einzigartige
Schadsoftware produzieren ...

English:
In other words, Jude had it all: productivity,
mobility, you name it. ...Um, so they say.
Chinese:
也就是說“Jude”不論在生產性或機動力，
都是最強團隊……這全都是我聽來的。
Korean:
즉, 쥬드는 생산성, 기동성, 어느 쪽이든
최고의 팀이었단 소리야…… 어디까지나 들은 이야기지만
German:
Mit anderen Worten, bei Gamma gab es alles:
Produktivität, Mobilität, alles, was du dir
denken kannst.

English: But what made Jude a legend wasn't its size...
Chinese:
但是……“Jude”會成為傳說，
並不是因為龐大的規模。
Korean:
하지만……"쥬드"를 전설로 만든 것은
규모의 크기가 아냐
German:
Aber Gamma wurde nicht wegen seiner Größe zur
Legende ...

English: It was...the conviction they all shared.
Chinese: 而是因為那些人……有著信念。
Korean: 녀석들은……신념이 있었어
German: Es war ... die Überzeugung, die sie alle teilten.

English:
It wasn't a hard-and-fast rule, mind you. It's
just that, not one of them used hacking for evil.
Chinese:
雖然沒被明文規定，
但沒有任何人是為了作惡去入侵程式。
Korean:
명확한 룰이 있었던 것은 아니지만
누구 하나 해킹을 악용하려고는 하지 않았어
German:
Es war zwar kein bindendes Gesetz, aber keiner
von ihnen setzte das Hacken für böse Zwecke ein.

English:
They only acted to raise their skill, or just sate
their curiosity.
Chinese:
頂多是想提升自己的技術，
為了滿足好奇心，才會採取行動。
Korean:
어디까지나 자신들의 기술을 높이기 위해
호기심을 채우기 위해 녀석들은 활동하고 있었던 거야
German:
Sie handelten bloß, um ihre Fähigkeiten zu
verbessern oder um ihre Neugier zu stillen.

English:
The Under Zero business, too... I'd say they only
broke in because they were that kind of people.
Chinese:
“Under Zero”也是……只有他們才突破得了，
我是這麼想的啦。
Korean:
"언더 제로"도……그런 놈들이니까
돌파할 수 있던거라고 난 생각해
German:
Sogar die Angelegenheit mit Unter Null ... Ich
glaube, sie sind da nur eingebrochen, weil das
ihre Art war.

English: You haven't heard about "Under Zero"?
Chinese:
你沒聽過嗎？
Under Zero。
Korean:
들은 적 없어?
언더 제로
German: Du hast nicht von „Unter Null“ gehört?

English:
It's a core server that's existed since the start
of EDEN. It contains all of the log data inscribed
into EDEN up to now.
Chinese:
那是指EDEN創世紀以來就存在的核心伺服器，
在那保存了至今所有EDEN的紀錄資料。
Korean:
EDEN 창세기부터 존재하는 코어 서버로
이제까지 EDEN에 새겨진 모든 로그 데이터가
보존되어 있어
German:
Das ist ein wichtiger Server, den es seit Beginn
von EDEN gibt. Er enthält alle jemals erstellten
Protokolldaten für EDEN.

English:
In other words...it's actually EDEN's greatest
security fortress.
Chinese: 可以說是……EDEN最高層級的防範要塞。
Korean: 즉…… 사실상 EDEN의 최고봉 보안 요새
German:
Mit anderen Worten ist es EDENs wichtigstes
Sicherheitsbollwerk.

English:
Taking that fortress made Jude the strongest team
in EDEN, both in name and deed.
Chinese:
只要能攻陷它，Jude就會成為在EDEN中
名符其實的最強團隊。
Korean:
여기를 함락한다면 쥬드는 명실상부 EDEN
최강의 팀이 된다
German:
Als sie das Bollwerk einnahmen, wurde Gamma zum
stärksten Team in EDEN, dem Namen und ihren
Taten nach.

English: ...At least it would have.
Chinese: ……原本會變成這樣才對。
Korean: ……되었을 테지
German: ... Oder zumindest wäre es so gewesen.

English: That is...if that guy hadn't shown up...
Chinese: 如果……當時沒有出現那種傢伙的話——
Korean: 거기에……그런 녀석이 나타나지만 않았다면――
German: Wenn ... dieser Typ nicht aufgetaucht wäre ...

English: No, it's... It's nothing.
Chinese: ……沒有，沒什麼大不了的。
Korean: ……아니, 아무것도 아냐―
German: Nein, es ... ist schon gut.

English:
Anyway, Jude failed in conquering Under Zero, and
then disbanded just like that.
Chinese:
總之Jude在進攻Under Zero時失敗，
也因此解散了。
Korean:
어쨌든 쥬드는 그 언더 제로 공략에 실패하고
그대로 해산해버렸다는 거지
German:
Jedenfalls hat Gamma es nicht geschafft, Unter
Null zu erobern. Danach hat sich die Gruppe
einfach so aufgelöst.

English:
All right, now it's your turn. Tell me what those
guys've been up to la--
Chinese:
再來，該換你告訴我了吧？
最近那些人的——
Korean:
자아, 다음은 네가 가르쳐줘.
최근 그 녀석들의――
German:
So, jetzt bist du dran. Erzähl mir, was sie in
letzter Zeit so gemacht ha...

English: Dammit, not these guys again! Stop butting in!
Chinese:
……嘖，怎麼又是這傢伙——！
總是來打斷我！
Korean:
……칫, 또 이 녀석인가!
방해하다니!
German:
Mist, nicht schon wieder die! Hört auf,
euch einzumischen!

English:
Let's beat 'em! These guys'll cause a real mess if
we leave them alone. You must be pretty good if
you're part of Hudie, right?
Chinese:
打倒他！　放這傢伙不管會出事。
你如果是hudie，應該能對付吧？
Korean:
쓰러뜨리자! 이 녀석은 방치해두면 위험해.
댁, 후디에라면 조금은 쓸만하겠지?
German:
Besiegen wir sie! Diese Typen verursachen sonst
unglaubliches Chaos. Wenn du bei Hudie bist,
musst du gut sein, nicht wahr?

English: Glad to hear it. I'm counting on you, kid!
Chinese:
那就好。
那麼……交給你了喔！！
Korean:
그거 잘됐군.
그럼…… 의지해보겠어!!
German:
Freut mich, das zu hören. Ich verlasse mich
auf dich.
